definition: to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work/also written 偷閒|偷闲[tou1 xian2]
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work

sentences.english: On a recent weekday she interrupted her workday to take her son to the doctor.
sentences.chinese: 最近一个工作日她忙里偷闲带儿子去看医生。

sentences.english: I want to steal time to learn english.
sentences.chinese: 我想忙里偷闲去学习英语。

sentences.english: I usuwhichley kill my available time by enjoying the movie.
sentences.chinese: 我常常看影片来消磨我的休息偷闲具体时间。

sentences.english: Alternatively, you may just want to take a break from work for a while.
sentences.chinese: 此外，也许你也正想从忙碌的工作中偷闲休息一下呢。

sentences.english: Weekends are the time for many people to goof off .
sentences.chinese: 周末是许多人偷闲的时间。

sentences.english: Located in the center of Causeway Bay, it is the most convenient hideaway from this hectic city.
sentences.chinese: 位于铜锣湾的心脏地带，是闹市中偷闲的最好去处。

sentences.english: Love is the business of the idle and the idleness of the busy.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是闲人的正经事，忙人的偷闲玩意。

sentences.english: The fairy also needs to have leisure.

definition: to take some time out/to make use of a spare moment
to shy away from work/to get by without attending duty
to spend one's leisure time/to idle away the time
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
variant of 閒人|闲人[xian2 ren2]/idle person/idler/unconcerned person
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
